info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 20 at 2:32PM CDT until March 21 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
...NEAR CRITICAL TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUE INTO THIS EVENING AND AGAIN FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY EVENING...
The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Friday.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains.
* TIMING...1 PM through 8 PM CDT Friday.
* WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent.
* TEMPERATURES...In the upper 50s to lower 60s.
* LIGHTNING...Not expected.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop may spread rapidly and be difficult or impossible to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR MUCH OF WESTERN AND SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA
